name: Sammy

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Thanks for getting us out of there, mungo. We're gonna head back home now.

topics.topic_text: Do you like classes with Joseph?
topics.response_text: Yeah. What I don't like's being bugged when I'm trying to learn.

topics.topic_text: Can you give me directions?
topics.response_text: Where to, mungo?{grudgingly}

topics.topic_text: Do you enjoy guarding the back gate?
topics.response_text: No, because Princess always bosses me around and there's never nothing to gun.

topics.topic_text: Can you tell me why Princess gets angry about her nickname?
topics.response_text: So, a long time ago, Princess convinced everyone that she should be mayor.

topics.topic_text: She was only mayor for five minutes?
topics.response_text: Yeah! MacCready said we needed someone to watch out for us, not to lord over us. Then he popped her one! She hasn't even tried since then.

topics.topic_text: Does she still hold a grudge against them?
topics.response_text: No way. I think she's got a crush on him. She's all weird for him.

topics.topic_text: Thanks, Sammy. That's useful information.
topics.response_text: Thanks. Maybe you can take her down a peg, huh?{chuckles a little at the compliment}

topics.topic_text: Get lost, kid.
topics.response_text: Thanks for nothing, ass.

topics.topic_text: You're already out. Can't you just run home from here?
topics.response_text: You saw what happened to that other guy. Same thing'd happen to me if I try to run away now.

topics.topic_text: Sure, what can I do to help, kid?
topics.response_text: This collar. It's gotta get turned off, or else I can't get out of here. You saw what happened to that other guy.

topics.topic_text: Why is this my problem? In case you hadn't noticed, I've already got problems.
topics.response_text: I just thought maybe you could do something, since they're all gonna shoot you anyway.

topics.topic_text: I'll get you kids out of here.
topics.response_text: You're okay for a mungo. Squirrel and Penny are still stuck inside. You need to get the key to the slave pen to get 'em out.

topics.topic_text: Let me think about it.
topics.response_text: Think about it? Come on, mungo. You can do it.

topics.topic_text: Sorry kid. You're on your own.
topics.response_text: Thanks for nothing, mungo.

topics.topic_text: How can I get you out of here?
topics.response_text: Can't you just shoot them all?

topics.topic_text: Nope. Never heard of it.
topics.response_text: Sure. Most mungos like you don't know where it is. We like it that way.

topics.topic_text: Yeah, I've heard of it.
topics.response_text: Well we need to get out of here and get back there. Right now. So you gotta help us, okay?

topics.topic_text: Mayor MacCready's the one who sent me to get you.
topics.response_text: Really? I knew it! I knew he'd come to get us!{surprised, thrilled}

topics.topic_text: Don't worry, I've got a plan.
topics.response_text: You do? Great!

topics.topic_text: That's the best you can come up with? Don't you have any other ideas?
topics.response_text: Well, I mean, Squirrel thinks maybe he could use the computer in here to turn off the collars.

topics.topic_text: No way. I can't take them all on.
topics.response_text: No? You sure?

topics.topic_text: Pipe down, short stuff. I'm trying to get you out of here.
topics.response_text: What? That's a load of shit. We're not stupid, you know. We've seen what you mungos are like.

topics.topic_text: Do you want to get rescued or not?
topics.response_text: Rescued? This is a pretty stupid way to rescue anybody, mungo.

topics.topic_text: MacCready sent me. I'm here to rescue you.
topics.response_text: God, why didn't you say that?

topics.topic_text: Fine. Would you rather stay here with the Slavers?
topics.response_text: Well... No. You better be telling the truth, mungo, or else we're going to kill you in your sleep.

topics.topic_text: Keep quiet, will you? Let's get out of here, then we can talk.
topics.response_text: What is there to talk about? I know what you're doing. You're going to take us somewhere and make us work for you... or worse.

topics.topic_text: Look, I came from Little Lamplight.
topics.response_text: You did? You better not be lying. Fine, let's go.

topics.topic_text: Who are you?
topics.response_text: I'm Sammy. I'm from Little Lamplight. Me and Squirrel and Penny... We aren't supposed to be here.

topics.topic_text: Why would I help you? What's in it for me?
topics.response_text: Look, we're not supposed to be in here. We live in Little Lamplight. Ever heard of it?

topics.topic_text: Can you tell me why Princess gets angry about her nickname?
topics.response_text: No. Because I don't trust you.

conversation.response_text: Someday, you're gonna get yours, Princess.{Sullen, mumbled, and a little defeated.}
I wanna know more about shooting.
Yes, teacher.{A little frustrated at being told what he already knows.}
Everything's okay out back, Mayor. Same as ever.{bored}
Hey, that's the mungo. Go talk to him.

description:
Sammy is a 11 year-old Hispanic Male.

A young boy from Little Lamplight with a somewhat feminine face and exceptional rifle skills. As the youngest member of the settlement's scavenging team, Sammy serves as a lookout at the back door, where he's often teased by Princess.

Sammy's Personality: Determined and loyal to his friends, Sammy can be stubborn and easily irritated when left out of important plans. Despite his young age, he shows resilience in the face of adversity.

Sammy's Backstory: Born in the Wasteland, Sammy grew up in Little Lamplight, a settlement exclusively for children. He formed a close friendship with Squirrel and became part of their scavenging team. Known for his exceptional aim with rifles, Sammy took his role seriously, often standing guard at the settlement's back entrance. In early August 2277, during a trading run with Squirrel, the two were captured by slavers working for Rip Smithy and subsequently sold to Eulogy Jones at Paradise Falls.
